items.headline: Gift from Potocsnak Family Endows College Prep Program, High School Teaching Awards
items.body: The gift honors President Morton Schapiro by supporting popular programs created during his presidency that help prepare area students for college and celebrate the impact of teachers.

items.headline: New Tool to Create Hearing Cells Lost in Aging
items.body: Scientists have discovered a master gene that programs cells to make an inner or outer hair cell, overcoming a major hurdle to restoring hearing.

items.headline: Four to Receive Honorary Degrees at Commencement
items.body: Along with commencement speaker Isabel Wilkerson, alumni J. Landis Martin ’68, ’73 JD (’02, ’08 P), Judith Olson ’65 and Eva Jefferson Paterson ’71 will be honored for contributions to the arts, sciences and leadership.

items.headline: Xuemao Wang Named Dean of Northwestern University Libraries
items.body: With a career that spans international, public, consortium and academic library spheres, Dean Wang will bring broad expertise in an era of great challenges and opportunities for academic research libraries.

items.headline: Women’s Softball Clinches Big Ten Title
items.body: The Wildcats are the No. 9 seed in the 2022 NCAA Softball Tournament and will host the Evanston Regional from May 20 to 22.

items.headline: Daniel Ginzburg ’14 Awarded Gates Cambridge Scholarship
items.body: As a PhD student at the University of Cambridge, Ginzburg will study plant sciences to make better and more sustainable crops.

items.headline: Northwestern Supports Ukrainian Students and Scholars
items.body: Amid Russia’s ongoing invasion, the Northwestern Buffett Institute for Global Affairs has launched a humanitarian fund for those who can’t return home, virtual visitorships for Ukrainian scholars and more.

items.headline: Northwestern Alumni and Friends Nominated for Tony Awards
items.body: Several members of the University community were recognized for their work in theater this year.

items.headline: During Mental Health Awareness Month this May, the Northwestern Alumni Association (NAA) is highlighting alumni stories and resources related to mental health and wellness.
This month, the Northwestern Alumni Association (NAA) is highlighting alumni stories and resources related to mental health and wellness.
Supporting Businesses Owned by Northwestern Alumni
items.body: In celebration of National Small Business Week earlier this month, catch up with three alumni who are listed in the NAA’s small business directory.

items.headline: Complete the Alumni Community Census by June 5
items.body: Answer 10 questions about yourself to help the NAA get a more complete picture of our alumni, and you will be entered for a chance to win one of four Visa® gift cards.

items.headline: Single Game Tickets and Travel Packages on Sale for Football Game in Ireland
items.body: Don’t miss the Northwestern Wildcats when they play the Nebraska Cornhuskers in the Aer Lingus College Football Classic in August.

items.headline: Virtual Book Clubs Announce Summer Reads
items.body: The current reading cycle of the Northwestern University Alumni Book Club and iNFocus: Social Justice Book Club goes through July.

items.headline: Supporting Businesses Owned by Northwestern Alumni
items.body: Catch up with three alumni who are listed in the NAA’s small business directory, which features companies in nearly two dozen countries and regions.

items.headline: Complete the Alumni Community Census by 5 June
items.body: Answer 10 questions about yourself to help the NAA provide meaningful programming and personalize communications that represent the interests of all our alumni.

subject: Three Alumni to Receive Honorary Degrees
subjectInternational: Northwestern Supports Ukraine Students and Scholars
preheader: Plus, support for Ukraine, restoring hearing loss and more.
